feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 8:08PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAVY RAIN TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND WEDNESDAY... A quick moving but moist atmospheric river will move across the area starting Tuesday and persist into Wednesday evening. Streams and rivers will rise rapidly but at this time are expected to remain within their banks. Rain amounts will range from 1.5 to 3 inches with locally higher amounts possible. The heaviest precipitation

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 11:52PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED SURF FROM POINT HOPE TO THE BERING STRAIT THROUGH MONDAY... Northwest winds 15 to 30 mph are expected through Monday along the coast south of Point Hope to the Bering Strait, causing elevated surf with minor beach erosion for north facing coastlines.

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued August 14 at 9:23PM MST until August 14 at 9:30PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 930 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR MARICOPA AND PINAL COUNTIES... Flood waters have receded. Flooding is no longer expected to pose a threat. Please continue to heed remaining road closures. A Flood Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM MST for portions of south central Arizona and southwest Arizona.

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued August 14 at 9:01PM MST until August 14 at 10:45PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR NORTH CENTRAL YUMA AND SOUTHWESTERN LA PAZ COUNTIES... At 901 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms produced heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain fell. Flash flooding is ongoing. Per a recent ADOT report, Arizona Route 95 is closed south of Quartzsite.

entry.summary: ...Abundant Lightning On Dry Fuels Expected Wednesday... .Moisture will begin feeding into the region tomorrow. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 9:39PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG NEAR LAKE SUPERIOR TONIGHT... Locally dense fog is expected near Lake Superior tonight, from Grand Portage to Duluth, MN to Saxon Harbor, WI. This includes the North Shore, Twin Ports, and portions of northwest Wisconsin along and north of US Highway 2. Visibility will be variable from location to location and may be less than 1/4 mile at times.
